item.description:
It's already the middle of September and I haven't even posted October's book yet! Shame on me, but I'm making up for it by 1) scheduling the meet-up for closer to mid-October than early October and 2) selecting a book that's just 240 pages, so everyone should have time to read it at their leisure.

In the next few days I'll also get up a new book poll so that we can choose November's read, and there will be a new question option: restaurant suggestions for where to meet. I'll figure somewhere out for October (guaranteed to be in Cambridge and within walking distance of the T), but if anyone can think of a venue that works well logistically for seating 15 or so people in a way that they can all hear each other, then shoot that info my way.

Our October book is The Convalescent by Jessica Anthony. It's about a non-verbal, Hungarian dwarf who sells meat out of a bus in Virginia. Give it a chance.

Amazon
Powell's
McSweeney's

Oh, I keep forgetting to add this to the postings, but if this is your first meeting, please bring $1 with which to buy yourself a lifetime of book-clubbing and to somewhat offset the cost of using MeetUp.

Nick
item.name: Cambridge Readers: The Convalescent by Jessica Anthony
